From Harry Bloom:

On March 1st at 4pm at the SASSDS Campus at One Commerce Way in Norwood,
the snow delayed program about /Janusz Korczak/ will take place.
(Please see attached mailer for details.)

Please RSVP for what promises to be an outstanding Middle School (and
up) parent/child learning opportunity sponsored by the Israel Arbeiter
Gallery of Understanding. Our own gifted educator, Moreh Shem (Bob
Minder), will be introducing a film by award
winning Polish director Andrej Wajda about /Janusz Korczak,/ a famous
physician and author and educator who ran an orphanage in the Warsaw
Ghetto during the 1930's and who insisted on accompanying his charges
when they were deported to a concentration camp.

Moreh Shem is an enthusiastic expert about /Janusz Korczak/, one of the
most enlightened child advocates of the 20th century. Based on alumni
testimonials, Moreh Shem's teaching is typically one of the most
remembered highlights of our students' experiences at SASSDS. This is a
golden opportunity for parents to learn from Moreh Shem with their
children. Don't miss it. However, space is limited and you must RSVP to
attend. Please email Diane Joiner at djoiner@sassds.org *no later than
Wednesday, February 25th* to reserve your places.

A limited number of bound copies of an original essay by Moreh Shem will
be available for session participants. Please indicate when you reserve
your places whether you would like us to put a copy aside for you.

Thank you.
item.name: Film and Lecture about Janusz Korczak
